t: Proverbs 19
Better*pn is a poor person who walks in his integrity than*ld one who is crooked in speech and is a fool.
Desire*ln without knowledge is not good, and*ld whoever makes haste with his feet misses his way.
When*ln a man’s folly brings his way to ruin, his*ld heart rages against the Lord.*s
Wealth*ln brings many new friends, but*ld a poor man is deserted by his friend.
A*ln false witness will not go unpunished, and*ld he who breathes out lies will not escape.
Many*ln seek the favor of a generous man, and*ld everyone is a friend to a man who gives gifts.
All*ln a poor man’s brothers hate him; how*ld much more do his friends go far from him! He*ln pursues them with words, but does not have them.
Whoever*ln gets sense loves his own soul; he*ld who keeps understanding will discover good.
A*ln false witness will not go unpunished, and*ld he who breathes out lies will perish.
It*ln is not fitting for a fool to live in luxury, much*ld less for a slave to rule over princes.
Good*ln sense makes one slow to anger, and*ld it is his glory to overlook an offense.
A*ln king’s wrath is like the growling of a lion, but*ld his favor is like dew on the grass.
A*ln foolish son is ruin to his father, and*ld a wife’s quarreling is a continual dripping of rain.
House*ln and wealth are inherited from fathers, but*ld a prudent wife is from the Lord.*s
Slothfulness*ln casts into a deep sleep, and*ld an idle person will suffer hunger.
Whoever*ln keeps the commandment keeps his life; he*ld who despises his ways will die.
Whoever*ln is generous to the poor lends to the Lord,*s and*ld he will repay him for his deed.
Discipline*ln your son, for there is hope; do*ld not set your heart on putting him to death.
A*ln man of great wrath will pay the penalty, for*ld if you deliver him, you will only have to do it again.
Listen*ln to advice and accept instruction, that*ld you may gain wisdom in the future.
Many*ln are the plans in the mind of a man, but*ld it is the purpose of the Lord*s that will stand.
What*ln is desired in a man is steadfast love, and*ld a poor man is better than a liar.
The*ln fear of the Lord*s leads to life, and*ld whoever has it rests satisfied; he*ld will not be visited by harm.
The*ln sluggard buries his hand in the dish and*ld will not even bring it back to his mouth.
Strike*ln a scoffer, and the simple will learn prudence; reprove*ld a man of understanding, and he will gain knowledge.
He*ln who does violence to his father and chases away his mother is*ld a son who brings shame and reproach.
Cease*ln to hear instruction, my son, and*ld you will stray from the words of knowledge.
A*ln worthless witness mocks at justice, and*ld the mouth of the wicked devours iniquity.
Condemnation*ln is ready for scoffers, and*ld beating for the backs of fools.
